cyclone.name: IDALIA
cyclone.current_location: about 65 mi (105 km) NE of Cozumel, Mexico
cyclone.trajectory: expected to drift slowly north on Sunday, then accelerate north-northeast across the eastern Gulf toward the Florida Big Bend before curving across Georgia and the Carolinas out into the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast (near Cedar Key to Apalachee Bay)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches confined to western Cuba (Pinar del Río, Isle of Youth) – none along U.S. coast yet
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings limited to Yucatán Peninsula from Tulum to Río Lagartos – none along U.S. coast yet
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Eastern Gulf Coast of Florida northward into Georgia and the Carolinas, including the Georgia barrier-island shoreline near Brunswick
weather_observation.wind: Increasing onshore winds late Tuesday night into Wednesday could reach tropical-storm force (35–45 mph) around Brunswick with gusts higher in squalls.
weather_observation.storm_surge: With persistent east to southeast flow as the center passes inland, minor coastal inundation of 2–4 ft above ground level is possible in low-lying areas of the Georgia coast, including Brunswick harbor approaches.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could drop 4–6 inches with locally higher totals, producing ponding on terminal surfaces and potential flash flooding in adjacent low areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes possible in outer rain-bands on Wednesday; rough seas and long-period swells will affect approaches beginning late Tuesday.
